\subsection*{Contents}

\begin{itemize}
\setlength{\itemsep}{-1ex}
   \item Performance metric
   \item Stock shaft
   \item Shaft machining
   \item Shaft splines
   \item Keyways
   \item Retaining ring grooves
   \item Bearings and shaft collars
   \item Minor components (not contributing to cost)
   \item Bolts
   \item Total cost
\end{itemize}


\subsection*{Performance metric}

\begin{par}
The performance metric is caclated based on all selected components as spesified in the assingment.
\end{par} \vspace{1em}
\begin{verbatim}
cost = 0;
\end{verbatim}


\subsection*{Stock shaft}

\begin{verbatim}
spesificWeight = 7.87e3; % [kg/m^3] spesific weight of stainless steel

diameter = 37e-3; % [m] diameter of shafts
length = 12 * 25.4e-3 ; % [m] length of shaft drum+middle+motor in inches
volume = pi*diameter^2/4 * length; % [m^3] total shaft volume
shaftWeight = volume * spesificWeight; % [kg] total mass of shafts
costShaft = 15 * shaftWeight % [$] total cost of shafts

cost = cost + costShaft;
\end{verbatim}

        \color{lightgray} \begin{verbatim}
costShaft =

   38.6878

\end{verbatim} \color{black}
    

\subsection*{Shaft machining}

\begin{verbatim}
lengthRemoved = (1+1) * 25.4e-3; % [m]
outerDiameter = 37e-3; % [m] diameter of shafts
innerDiameter = 25e-3; % [m] diameter of bearings

removedVolume = pi * (outerDiameter^2 - innerDiameter^2)/4 * lengthRemoved; % [m^3] total volume of shaft to be removed
machiningWeight = removedVolume * spesificWeight; % [kg] total weight of material to be machined
costMachining = 75 * machiningWeight

cost = cost + costMachining;
\end{verbatim}

        \color{lightgray} \begin{verbatim}
costMachining =

   17.5211

\end{verbatim} \color{black}
    

\subsection*{Shaft splines}

\begin{par}
Not used
\end{par} \vspace{1em}


\subsection*{Keyways}

\begin{verbatim}
keywayLength = 0.28 * 7.112e-3; % [m]
costKeyway = 15+0.5*keywayLength % total cost of machining keyways

cost = cost + costKeyway;
\end{verbatim}

        \color{lightgray} \begin{verbatim}
costKeyway =

   15.0010

\end{verbatim} \color{black}
    

\subsection*{Retaining ring grooves}

\begin{verbatim}
costGrove = 10 + 0.5 * (innerDiameter - 10e-3) % total cost of machining groves

cost = cost + costGrove;
\end{verbatim}

        \color{lightgray} \begin{verbatim}
costGrove =

   10.0075

\end{verbatim} \color{black}
    

\subsection*{Bearings and shaft collars}

\begin{verbatim}
boreDiameter = 25; % [mm] bore diameter of bearings
bearingPricePerUnit = 20 + 2*(boreDiameter - 10); % cost per bearing
costBearings = 2 * bearingPricePerUnit % total cost of 2 bearings

cost = cost + costBearings;
\end{verbatim}

        \color{lightgray} \begin{verbatim}
costBearings =

   100

\end{verbatim} \color{black}
    

\subsection*{Minor components (not contributing to cost)}



\subsection*{Bolts}

\begin{verbatim}
costBolts = 4 * (5 - 4) % total cost of four bolts

cost = cost + costBolts;
\end{verbatim}

        \color{lightgray} \begin{verbatim}
costBolts =

     4

\end{verbatim} \color{black}
    

\subsection*{Total cost}

\begin{verbatim}
display(['Total cost: ' num2str(cost)]);
\end{verbatim}

        \color{lightgray} \begin{verbatim}Total cost: 185.2175
\end{verbatim} \color{black}
